title: 110_hr5908
content: Zero percent capital gains rate for individuals and corporations. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a zero percent capital gains rate for individuals. This change also applies to the alternative minimum tax and repeals the sunset of reduction in capital gains rates. The Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003 repeals the sunset of reduction in capital gains rates for individuals. Additionally, the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a zero percent capital gains rate for corporations. The text chunk describes the calculation of the net capital gain tax rates, including 0 percent for adjusted net capital gain, 25 percent for unrecaptured section 1250 gain, and 28 percent for taxable income exceeding certain thresholds. The text chunk defines terms related to net capital gain and unrecaptured section 1250 gain for tax purposes, as well as the maximum rate of tax on net capital gain for corporations under the alternative minimum tax. The text chunk includes technical amendments to various sections of the tax code, changing the tax rates from percentages to 0 percent in certain cases. The tax code is amended to change tax rates to 0 percent in certain cases, effective for taxable years ending after the enactment date. Withholding amendments apply to dispositions and distributions after the enactment date.
